conversation.text: Hi! What can I help you?
Is your weisswurst raw or pre-cooked?
evidence: Determine if your weisswurst is raw or pre-cooked

conversation.text: Then you  need to grill your weisswurst over medium-low heat.
evidence: Grill the raw weisswurst over medium-low heat.

conversation.text: Then brush your grill gate with vegetable oil. Then place weisswurst on it over indirect  heat.
evidence: Brush the grill grate with vegetable oil, so the sausages don't stick to the grill. Place the weisswurst on the grill over indirect heat.

conversation.text: Done. How do I grill it then?
Have you grill reached 140 F degree?
Remember to frequently turn the sausages and added water or beer if needed.
evidence: Frequently turn the sausages and spray them with a little water or beer

conversation.text: How do I know when the water or beer is needed?
If the sausages do not evenly brown, do it.
evidence: so they brown evenly and don't split.

conversation.text: Then remove sausages from the grill to a serving plate. You can lay a sheet of aluminum foil over them and let them rest for 5 minutes.
evidence: Remove the cooked weisswurst from the grill and transfer them to a serving plate. Lay a sheet of aluminum foil over the sausages and let them rest for 5 minutes.

conversation.text: 5 minutes have passed. Can I eat them now?

evidence: then you can serve the hot weisswurst

procedure.summary: Determine if your weisswurst is raw or pre-cooked.
procedure.description: Ask the butcher if the weisswurst you're buying needs to be fully cooked or just reheated. If you're buying packaged weisswurst, read the cooking instructions to determine if you should fully cook the sausages.

procedure.summary: Reheat weisswurst on the grill if they're precooked.
procedure.description: Since many packaged weisswurst are precooked, you can simply toss them onto a medium-heat grill. Cover the grill and cook the weisswurst until they're completely hot throughout. Turn the weisswurst occasionally and grill them for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve the hot weisswurst. Avoid poking the weisswurst casing with a fork, knife or tongs to prevent the flavorful liquid inside the sausage from leaking.

procedure.summary: Grill the raw weisswurst over medium-low heat.
procedure.description: Prepare a gas or charcoal grill for medium-heat. Brush the grill grate with vegetable oil, so the sausages don't stick to the grill. Place the weisswurst on the grill over indirect heat. Cover the grill and let the weisswurst cook until they reach 140 °F (60 °C). Frequently turn the sausages and spray them with a little water or beer, so they brown evenly and don't split.

procedure.summary: Rest and serve the grilled weisswurst.
procedure.description: Remove the cooked weisswurst from the grill and transfer them to a serving plate. Lay a sheet of aluminum foil over the sausages and let them rest for 5 minutes. They'll finish cooking and then you can serve the hot weisswurst. You can store leftover grilled weisswurst in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 3 to 4 days.
